TEXT.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
TEXT.source: ['3. aney o ango ko!', '還我林投果！', 'Give back my pandanus!', '', 'si apen Kotan/Jinovoy (M, 75, Yayo)', '王仁德，男，75，椰油村', '']

S.FORM: am-ian namen do Jimasapaw am, am sinodo ji pa mi-agza o dehdeh, tey-má-kcin namen a, a ikong o kan-en nokakoa,
S.TRANSL: 我們走到Jimasapaw時，還不到外地人吃午飯的時間，我們就已經很餓了； 以前哪有什麼可吃的東西？
As we walked to Jimasapaw, it wasn’t time for people from the outside to eat lunch yet, but we were already hungry. There never used to be anything to eat.

S.FORM: “mo ke-hakay” koan ko am, “ikong”, “o ito so ya map-adon so ya todaji ma-kamak a ango a, hap-en ta an,
S.TRANSL: 我說“喂！” “什麼事？” “你看那個人的揹籃上面擺了一個成熟的林投果，我們去把它拿下來好不好？
“Hey!” I said. “What?” “Look at that very ripe pandanus put on top of that person’s basket! Why don’t we go get it?

S.FORM: i-toro ko jimo a, i-palayo mo” koan ko a, “a nohon” koan na, a pasobna-an na yaken an.
S.TRANSL: 我（去拿）給你，你就帶著跑” 我說，“好啊” 他說。反正他對我從來不會有異議的
“I’ll throw it to you, and you run with it.” “Okay,” he said, for he never opposed me.

S.FORM: to namen rana a-sinmo am, “ka-vakes kong!” koan ko a,
S.TRANSL: 後來我們迎面遇上了（那個女人），我就說“（女性朋友）你好！”
I went over to meet the woman, and greeted her, “Hello!”

S.FORM: ta iya rana ori am, mina mavakes na sio ni mina Cikno sio, a mina ka-gaga-n ko am, o ri o rako a mavakes a,
S.TRANSL: 她呢，就是我已故的朋友si Cikno之妻，那女人個兒滿高壯的
She was my friend si Cikno’s wife and she was tall and strong.

S.FORM: ratateng am, “a ya mo i-pang-asi, mo Sezez, mo pang-amay? ko imo i-ciapaw a ji niri-siring-a, mo pang-amay” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 後來，她說“你少來了！死Sezez，我才懶得理你呢！”
“Who are you greeting? Why should I pay any attention to you, snotty si Sezez?”

S.FORM: ratateng am, likod-an na yamen am, to ko ngatkát-a do tey-ngato no yala na o,
S.TRANSL: 就在跟她擦身而過之際，我即轉身抓取了她背上的林投果，
Just as she brushed past me, I turned and took the pandanus out of her basket.

S.FORM: a ji a-kmi vanga o ango a, to ko noró-an ji apen Sidongen am, to na malayó-an am,
S.TRANSL: 那林投果像一個鍋子那麼大。我拿到之後就丟給了si apen Sidongen，然後他拿了就跑
That pandanus was as big as a pot. Once I got it, I immediately threw it to si apen Sidongen. Once he caught it, he ran.

S.FORM: to nóngay o mavakes ori am, liliw-en na o apid-an na am, má-paw a, “a ajin do jia ori o ya ma-réhmet ang?”, to na amtád-an am,
S.TRANSL: 那女人往前一走，感覺到揹的東西變輕了，於是放下籃子看看，“奇怪，剛才揹的重物到哪裡去了？”
The woman had only walked a few steps when she noticed her basket was considerably lighter, and she thought, “Where have the heavy things gone?” and she put her basket down to look.

S.FORM: “a ya nio ni-ha-hap o ri, mo Sezez a, mo mina Vekeh” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: “喂！Sezez，死si Vekeh！是你們拿走了（林投果）嗎？”
“Hey! Sezez, damn si Vekeh! Did you steal my pandanus?”

S.FORM: ke-kezdas na am, to maláyo a m-ai jiamen am, ori a k-aong na jiamen a.
S.TRANSL: 後來她就拿著鐮刀跑來追砍我們
She picked up her sickle and chased after us,

S.FORM: am-ian rana do a-arang-an am, “na, o ito do Jikavatoan rana a, to ta rana pa-panála do jia,
S.TRANSL: 我們到了海邊停放船處時，“ㄟ，她在Jikavatoan了，不如我們就在這裡等她吧
until we reached the harbor. “She’s almost at Jikavatoan, so why don’t we just stop and wait for her here?”

S.FORM: ta to ta rana mika-ra-roá-i a ka-sanga-sangab ta sia pori-poris-en, vonong mo o na pinan-an a, vonong ko o ai-ai na,
S.TRANSL: 我們兩個一起來（修理她），你負責搶她手上的東西，我負責（纏住）她的腳
“The two of us can easily rough her up. You take what she is holding, and I’ll tangle up her legs

W.TRANSL: 虛.動綴-疊-兩人合力-處焦.虛

S.FORM: a ka-za-zasag ta jia, a ikong na to níwciw-i jiaten?”, “nohon”, a pasobna-an na yaken an,
S.TRANSL: 然後用力的把她踩在腳下，誰叫她來追我們？” “好！” 反正他不會對我有異議
and keep her down with my feet. Why is she chasing us?” “Sure.” Has he ever had a different opinion from mine?

S.FORM: to namen pa-panála am, todaji maka-ránes am, “ci m-ai kamo pala cimaraw” koan na am, to na mi-oli ori a,
S.TRANSL: 我們就在那裡等著。當她快到的時候，她就對我們說“明天你們來的時候，等著瞧吧” ，然後就折回去了
There we waited. When she was in sight, she said, “Just wait, I’ll get you tomorrow,” and turned back for home.

S.FORM: to namen rana os-a Jizakazang a, “o ito a, ya rana m-ian Jimasapaw o ya ta ni-a-hap-an so ango”, “ey! akan o ya” koan namen o rako a ango a,
S.TRANSL: 我們在Jizakazang一邊吃著林投果，一邊看著折返回去的那女人，說，“看啊，被我們搶了林投果的那個女人已經到了Jimasapaw” 。“喂，來吃（大林投果）哦！”
We ate the pandanus at Jizkazang as we watched the woman walk away. “Look, the woman who we stole from is already at Jimasapaw”.” Come on! Come and eat the big pandanus!”

S.FORM: ji namen ni-pi-sir-siring si ke-hakay a, ika-doa na araw am, ji á-ni-m-ai si apen Sidongen ito a,
S.TRANSL: 我們兩個好朋友事先也沒有講好。第二天的時候si apen Sidongen居然沒有上學校
We didn’t discuss anything that day. The next day, si apen Sidongen (surprisingly) didn’t come to school.

S.FORM: ji ko a-nake-nakem ori o mina ka-hap namen sia ori a, am-ian do Jikanayopan do vahay da no Lan’en am, to namen a-sinmo a,
S.TRANSL: 對於曾經搶過別人的林投果一事，我早已忘了。偏偏我們走到Jikanayopan處，即蘭恩目前的所在處時，又遇上了她
I had totally forgotten about the theft. As I walked to Jikanayopan, where Lan’en is located, I saw her again.

S.FORM: “o ito si koito a, ikong na cita-en ni koito” koan no karoan namen am, i-pa-makong na o ke-kezdas na,
S.TRANSL: 我們其它的同學說“你看那個人，她在找什麼呀？” 她高舉著鐮刀作預備砍划的手勢
“Look, what is she looking for?” other classmates said. She held up a sickle and pretended she was ready to kill.

S.FORM: “ajin jia si Sezez” koan na, “a ken ito do pa-na-navak na”,
S.TRANSL: 她說“si Sezez在哪裡？” ，“在中間那裡啊”
“Where is si Sezez?” she asked.“He’s in the middle.”

S.FORM: “ta ya mo kala-n jiaken” koan ko am, “a to mo ngap-i so ango, mo ka-vazat” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: 我說“你找我幹什麼？” 她說“可惡，你為什麼拿走我的林投果？”
“What’s up?” I said. “Damn! Why did you steal my pandanus?” she asked.

S.FORM: to ko monas-a jia o ke-kezdas na am, to ko vozcín-a am, to ko walít-an do ka-ango-an am,
S.TRANSL: 我先搶下了她手上的鐮刀，然後就丟到林投樹叢去了
I took away her sickle and threw it into the pandanus bushes.

S.FORM: “ka-vazat ka ya” koan na am, to na i nga-hap-a o ka-kali na am, to na ma-makóng-an jiaken am,
S.TRANSL: 她說“可惡！” 然後轉身又去拿了鐵棒來，對我作刺狀
“Shit!” she said, and turned to get a metal stick to run at me.

S.FORM: karoan namen am, “ana, a ci pokpok-en na do oo na am, mi-sisi o avang no oo na do ya ni-mi-golgol” koan no ka-raray namen a.
S.TRANSL: 我們其他的同學見狀，就都驚叫著“ㄟ，小心,別讓他敲了他的光頭啊,敲下去腦袋會裂開的！” 我們的同學說
Some of my classmates saw what was happening and shouted, “Hey, watch out and don’t let her crack his skull! He already is bald, so as soon as the stick hits him, his head will explode!”

S.FORM: ka-to da pangay-an sia do siri no ra-rahan a,
S.TRANSL: 同學們就（搶下鐵棒）擱置在路邊
The students took the stick and placed it on the side of the road.

S.FORM: ratateng am, to ngái jiaken am, to ko pa-panála am, to men mi-sápa a mi-rakep am,
S.TRANSL: 她繼續朝著我來，誰怕誰，我就等她，我們二人一碰上就抱起來開始摔角
She still came at me, not the least bit scared, and the two of us got into a wrestling match.

S.FORM: a pi-aw-awa-en da yamen am, to da pi-awa yamen,
S.TRANSL: 同學們想把我們分開，但哪裡分得開
The students had no idea how to separate us.

S.FORM: ratateng am, hap-en ko a rasay-in a savongit-en ko o ovok na, o ayo-ayob na am, zami-zamit-en ko a,
S.TRANSL: 我把她壓在地上，抓她的頭髮,扯破她的衣服
I held her to the ground, tore at her hair and ripped up her shirt.

S.FORM: ápira o ayob nokakoa? asa saon a bonbon no kazangangan na o ayob na am, am-ian so ayob nokakoa,
S.TRANSL: 以前有多少衣服？頂多一件可遮胸的衣服吧，以前哪有衣服
There just wasn’t that much clothing before. Her shirt was just enough to cover her chest.

S.FORM: om-lavi rana o ri a, ratateng am, ka-ngay namen rana mi-vate-vatek a.
S.TRANSL: 後來她哭了。我們也上學去了
She cried, and we went to school.

S.FORM: “a ji abo ka-ji da ’oya-an niaken nira kaka na” ta o ka-kteh na am, sira ma-lavayo a,
S.TRANSL: 我心想“她的哥哥們一定會罵我的” ，因為她的哥哥都還年輕
“Her elder brothers will come at me” I thought. Her brothers are still young.

S.FORM: a mina ka-doa araw a ji á-ni-mai si apen Sidongen ito a, ji ko a-nake-nákem o ri a, to ko angay a,
S.TRANSL: si apen Sidongen兩天沒上學，而我什麼也沒想到，就照樣上學去
Incidentally si apen Sidongen didn’t go to school during those two days. I didn’t even think about it, and I still went.

S.FORM: ratateng am, am-ian namen do, ta ra-rahan o inaorod da nira ori a, “wajin si Sezez” koan da,
S.TRANSL: 後來我們走到 的時候。由於他們前院是（去紅頭的必經）路徑。他們（她的長兄們）問說，“Sezez在哪裡？”
I have to pass through their front yard on the way to school, for it is the only way to Imowrod. When I got there, her brothers asked, “Where is si Sezez?”

S.FORM: “a ikong” koan ko am, “a ikong to mo pa-ka-kasi-i si wari, mo ka-kma si mina ama mo” koan na am, to mi-gé-gcin o an-anak a,
S.TRANSL: 我說“什麼事？” “該死的傢伙，為什麼欺負我妹妹？” 小哥哥說著就從涼台下來
“What’s up?” I asked. One of her brothers, the younger one, came down from the porch and said, “Asshole, how dare you rough up my sister?”

W.TRANSL: 動綴-疊-狠狠的打-處焦.虛

S.FORM: rak-rako a tao am, ji ní-g-om-cin a, to ngían do tagakal da,
S.TRANSL: 較壯的人（大哥）只待在涼台上沒有下來
The other brother, the stronger one, didn’t come down, staying on the porch.

S.FORM: “ana, mo Akay, ya da yaken paci-liman-an, mo Akay”,
S.TRANSL: 我叫喊著“祖父！有人要打我！”
“Grandpa! Someone is trying to hit me!” I cried.

S.FORM: o ri o ya ko sin-sinmo-en do mina k-apo da om-za-zasag jiaken no ka-kteh da nira am,
S.TRANSL: 以上是我親身經歷的，差點被他們兩兄弟給海扁了
This was all my personal experience. Those two brothers almost killed me.

S.FORM: o ri o icia-kmi koza-koza am, icia-kmi omowmalalam so nake-nakem a ji mápi-niwat so nakem a,
S.TRANSL: 這就是我，像貓狗一樣，想什麼說什麼，也不先想一下再說出來
That is how I am, like a dog or cat, never thinking before speaking, and saying whatever I want.

S.FORM: ji máka-teneng-i do ka-beywan da jia, ji máka-teng-i do k-avay da so kataotao am,
S.TRANSL: 搞不清楚人家是疼惜我，還是在罵我
Because of this, I don’t know whether people love me or hate me all the time.

S.FORM: o ri o ya ko sin-sinmo-en o akma so sang a.
S.TRANSL: 以上是我個人親身經歷的故事
This is my personal experience.

S.FORM: i-palayo na rana ni apen Sidongen a,
S.TRANSL: si apen Sidongen早就已經帶著（林投果）跑了
Si apen Sidongen was already heading into the woods with the pandanus.

S.FORM: “síno o ri, ta mi-arap namen” koan na ni Akay icialaw a, ji rana mi-zi-ziak o ni-g-om-cin ori a, ka-to ko rana angáy-an a,
S.TRANSL: 我的祖父說，“是誰欺負你，我去跟他拼命！” 下來的那個人（小哥）聽了就不敢講什麼，只好折回涼台去了，我也就走了。
“If anyone dares touch you, they’ll have to deal with me!” my grandfather said. When her brother, the younger one, heard this, he backed off and went back to their porch. So I left.
